questions.question: According to the text, only information you actively type and submit, like a comment, is considered data.
What is the primary reason traditional data processing software struggles with 'Big Data'?
options: It was no longer a compatible version.
It is too expensive to run.
It cannot process data from social media.
The amount of data is too immense to be analyzed practically.
It was not designed to be used by modern companies.

questions.question: Modern _________ help us interpret and extract valuable insights and patterns from the ocean of data.
Which of the following are considered sources of Machine-Generated Data? Select all that apply.
options: A comment on a social media post
A smartwatch tracking your heart rate
Location data from a delivery truck
The items you bought in an online store

sections.section: 1.2: A little history lesson on Big Data

questions.question: The concept of 'Big Data' was born from a problem faced by massive indexing services like Google & Yahoo. What was that problem?
options: They did not have enough powerful servers.
They needed to index and organize the entire World Wide Web.
They couldn't hire enough data analysts.
Their users were not generating enough data.
They did not know how to get data.

questions.question: The method of distributing a workload across many cheaper servers is known as _________ _________.
Traditional relational databases were well-suited for the messy and unstructured data of the web because of their rigid structure.
